reviews.text: Excellent Glasgow city center hotel!!! We were a group of 6 girls on an Xmas shopping trip. When we arrived we were given a room in the recently extended part to the hotel. Everything was spotlessly clean the bathroom was very spacious. the bed were comfy and the decor was very modern. The room also provided tea and coffee making facilities and bottles of mineral water free of charge. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis. The breakfast was great and provided plenty of choice. The hotel is an excellent location right beside central station and with great proximity to the shops.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem!!!

reviews.text: We found it very hard during our stay to get a restaurant in Glasgow where we could just walk in off the street as it seemed everywhere was very busy. So if looking to eat I would recommend u book earlier in the day.
reviews.title: You get exactly what you pay for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the whole we had an excellent stay and would definitely book this hotel again.
reviews.title: good value hotel

reviews.text: Arrived to see a dated entrance.. The receptionist, wearing jeans n a jumper, was more interested in talking to the male employee than us.. Eventually checked in and took the extremely small lift to the first floor!
reviews.title: Disappointed.

reviews.text: The public area wasn't exactly the cleanest I've seen, the carpet clearly hadn't been hoovered that day. Or maybe even the day before..
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: Super clean, stayed just after renovations, place had that 'new wood' smell. Breakfast was decent. Nice waterfall shower. Price was even better £99 for 2 people for 2 nights. 1 block away from the huge shopping area. Had to hop a bus from the airport, hotel was about 3 blocks down from the bus stop. Only complaints, place was a bit hard to find only because of the small entrance, the flooring in the general areas were 'spongey' like they overlaid the new carpet over the old, and the windows were pretty thin, so you could hear everything from the street. I'd stay again though, just bring ear plugs.
reviews.title: Easy on the wallet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Basic hotel just 5 minutes walk from central station. Lift and Bar. Comfortable meeing area. An ideal hotel for central Glasgow at a reasonable cost. £42 for double with breakfast included. We will definately use this place again. Even managed to check in early.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 night hogmanay break at this hotel. Having read other reviews I found this hotel to be good value for money.The room was clean and tidy very warm and a comfortable bed the staff pleasant and helpful yes there was noise during the night it was hogmanay maybe a room at the rear of the hotel would have been less noisy. The breakfast very good with a wide choice of items kept hot but not dried up. When booking in ask about offer on car parking at £6 for 24 hours a big reduction in normal chargers.This was our 2nd stay here and we will return in the future.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just arrived back from this hotel today to spend New Year in lovely Glasgow for change of scenery, as myself and my boyfriend are from Cumbria.
reviews.title: AVOID AVOID AVOID!!!

reviews.text: Firstly we arrived at the hotel expecting the 'warm Scottish welcome' we were promised, none of the staff being Scottish or merely welcoming. One member of staff stating quite clearly that she ‘hated bagpipes’.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideal location just a few steps from Central Station, huge modern room with tea and coffee making facilities, flat screen tv and 2 sofas. The bathroom was spotlessly clean and had complimentary toiletries and breakfast in the morning was good quality and plentiful. All in a great hotel and we will definitely return!
reviews.title: Great stay
Weekend in glasgow
reviews.text: Stayed at AlexanderThomson and was pleasantly surprised.Hotel staff were very helpful and pleasant..spotlessly clean and great value.located in city centre just a few minutes walk from Central station.

My friend and I booked this hotel for one night as we were going to a concert at the Clyde Auditorium. We jumped in a cab from the Station and the driver was less than positive about what we would find when we arrived. However, it was not as bad as he made it out to be. The hotel is actually a 2minute walk from Central Station and there is a Wetherspoons on the same side of the street, which we ate at and was very good. The hotel itself is dated but our room was very clean and tidy and had tea, coffee, biscuits and bottled water. The towels and bed linen were spotless and the bathroom was also clean and tidy. There was a flat screen tv on the wall if you wanted to use it. The staff at the hotel were ok, not the best in customer service but certainly not the worst. When we checked in the girl on the desk was pleasant but not really bothered with conversation. We slept ok and the room was cosy without being too hot, noise was not too bad as we were on the 5th floor. We did not hear any noise from other rooms or guests. Breakfast was ok, a full Scottish plus toast - didn't like the look of the croissants though as they appeared to be very stale on sight :( Breakfast was a buffet style which suited us. On the whole this hotel suited us for the 1 night and we only paid £20 each for the twin room, so you cannot expect 5 star luxury. The hotel is very central and all the shops, bars and stations are within walking distance.
reviews.title: Ok for 1 night

reviews.text: Excellent location in the city center. Excellent value for the rate you pay. The manager was quite helpful in giving useful directions for the couple of places I had to visit in a short time. The staff in dining room was always on attention. However, the quality of breakfast could do with some improvement..Tea arrangement in the room was quite useful on a wintry day.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: Hole kicked in bathroom door, shower missing dial, very used mattress that simply sunk when on it. Cleanliness not the best. Didn't sleep very good - banging music outside until 8am in the morning!! Heard every sound from the room above us... Which was a smoking floor (yak!!!).
reviews.title: Had to get drunk to go back into the hotel!

reviews.text: My husband and I booked on a website on the morning of 27th, we decided to head to Glasgow for a bit of shopping and few drinks we arrived at the hotel check in was quick and on to our room, basic but had everything you need, attention to detail in the cleanliness of bathroom could have been better.
reviews.title: For what you pay value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was ok, however although check out was 10.30 we received a knock on our door 10.25 to ensure we were leaving, we were actually on way out. Good for a one night stay and at a deal of £44 for the 2 of us was worth the money.
reviews.title: Good budget city centre hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't judge a book by its cover. This is a perfectly adequate hotel in terms of bedroom facilities. The location is ideal, very near to Central Station and in he heart of the Financial Services District.
reviews.title: TIRED OLD HOTEL

reviews.text: This place was relatively cheap - about £80per night online, however it is in dire need of a makeover, it looks like a seventies style hotel , fine if you like retro but it really is years out of date. Breakfast is the same every single day, without variation, the staff were rather ignorant in that the breakfast area was cleared whilst we were still eating.
reviews.title: Cheap and Cheerful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is nothing in the least 'Scottish' about the place and facilities were minimal to say the least. We had the luxury of a hairdryer in our room, although it was about forty years old!
reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful but very central and good breakfasts.
